text:
Consult Note
Pt: Olivia Harper MC #4321098
Date: 03/15/23 Harmony Medical Center OSCAR, SARAH Miami, FL 33101

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: The patient is a 62-year-old female with a history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. She presented with complaints of dizziness and mild chest discomfort experienced intermittently over the past week. Denies nausea or shortness of breath.

MEDICATIONS: The patient is currently on Lisinopril 20 mg q.d. and Atorvastatin 40 mg q.d. Aspirin 81 mg daily was added during the visit. She was advised to discontinue over-the-counter ibuprofen for headache management.

HOSPITAL COURSE: Electrocardiogram (ECG) revealed normal sinus rhythm with occasional premature ventricular contractions (PVCs). Blood pressure on arrival was 168/94 mmHg. Patient was started on Amlodipine 5 mg q.d. for better hypertension control and advised to return for follow-up in 10 days.

SOCIAL HISTORY: Retired school teacher, lives with her husband. Non-smoker, no alcohol use.

Consult Note
Pt: Ethan Clark MC #9843217
Date: 11/12/23 Sunshine Medical Center DR. JONES, EMILY Los Angeles, CA 90001

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: The patient is a 45-year-old male with Type 2 diabetes mellitus presenting with poorly controlled blood sugar levels over the past three months. Complains of fatigue and episodes of blurred vision, primarily in the evenings. No reports of dizziness or chest pain.

MEDICATIONS: The patient has been on Metformin 500 mg b.i.d. and Glipizide 10 mg q.d. for diabetes management. Additionally, Vitamin D 1000 IU daily was recommended during the consultation.

HOSPITAL COURSE: Fasting blood glucose was noted at 198 mg/dL, and HbA1c was 8.9%. Patient was started on Insulin Glargine 10 units subcutaneous injection nightly. Follow-up scheduled in 2 weeks for glucose monitoring and adjustment of the insulin dosage.

SOCIAL HISTORY: Works as a software engineer, married with two children. Occasionally consumes alcohol, denies smoking.

Consult Note
Pt: Sophia Martinez MC #5678903
Date: 07/09/22 Green Valley Clinic DR. LEE, ALEX New York, NY 10012

HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: The patient is a 33-year-old female presenting with recurrent migraines over the past six months. Episodes are associated with photophobia and nausea but no focal neurological deficits.

MEDICATIONS: Currently using Sumatriptan 50 mg PRN for migraines and Ibuprofen 400 mg PRN for mild pain relief. Prescribed Propranolol 20 mg b.i.d. as a preventive measure.

HOSPITAL COURSE: MRI of the brain was performed, which was unremarkable. Patient was advised on lifestyle modifications, including better sleep hygiene and regular exercise. A follow-up is scheduled in one month.

SOCIAL HISTORY: Works as a graphic designer, lives alone. Non-smoker, consumes alcohol socially.

------
                      BLOOD TEST REPORT
------

------
                          DISCHARGE SUMMARY
------
Patient Information:
Name:            Anuki Paskuel
Age:             68 years
Gender:          Female
Patient ID:      SJ1029384
Admission Date:  December 15, 2024
Discharge Date:  December 22, 2024

Attending Physician: Doctor Pradeep Dilshan
Nurse in Charge:      Kalpani Sneha

------
Reason for Admission:
------
The patient was admitted due to complaints of severe chest pain radiating to the left arm, accompanied by shortness of breath and dizziness. ECG confirmed an acute myocardial infarction (heart attack).

------
Hospital Course:
------
1. The patient was stabilized in the Emergency Department with oxygen and IV fluids.
2. Coronary angiography revealed significant blockage in the left anterior descending artery.
3. Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI) with stent placement was performed successfully.
4. Post-procedure monitoring in the ICU for 48 hours showed no complications.
5. The patient was transitioned to oral medications, including:
   - Aspirin 81 mg daily
   - Atorvastatin 40 mg daily
   - Clopidogrel 75 mg daily
6. Physical therapy and dietary consultations were provided before discharge.

------
Discharge Instructions:
------
1. Continue prescribed medications as listed above.
2. Avoid heavy physical activity for at least 4 weeks.
3. Schedule a follow-up appointment with Dr. Cole on January 15, 2025.
4. Monitor for signs of chest pain, difficulty breathing, or dizziness and report immediately.

------
                        END OF SUMMARY
------

------
                         MEDICAL CONSULTATION REPORT
------
Patient Information:
Name:            Yasiru Wathsala
Age:             54 years
Gender:          Male
Patient ID:      MT4502018
Consultation Date:  November 5, 2024

Referring Physician: Doctor Champa Dilhani
Consulting Physician: Dr. Nipun Gunathilake

------
Reason for Consultation:
------
The patient presented with complaints of chronic lower back pain radiating to the right leg, associated with tingling and numbness. Symptoms have persisted for the past three months and have not improved with over-the-counter analgesics.

------
Clinical Findings:
------
1. Physical examination revealed tenderness on palpation of the lumbar spine.
2. Positive straight leg raise test on the right side.
3. Decreased sensation in the right foot.
4. Motor strength intact in the lower extremities.

------
Assessment and Plan:
------
1. MRI of the lumbar spine was ordered to rule out disc herniation or other spinal abnormalities.
2. Prescribed medications:
   - Ibuprofen 400 mg every 6 hours for pain relief.
   - Gabapentin 300 mg daily for neuropathic pain.
3. Referral to physical therapy for a spine rehabilitation program.
4. Follow-up consultation scheduled in two weeks after MRI results.

------
                        END OF REPORT
------

------
                         MEDICAL CONSULTATION REPORT
------
Patient Information:
Name:            Chandani Bandara
Age:             36 years
Gender:          Female
Patient ID:      SW1023456
DOB:             March 15, 1988
Consultation Date:  December 2, 2024

Referring Physician: Dr. Robert Hayes
Consulting Physician: Dr. Geethika Senarath

------
Reason for Consultation:
------
The patient presented with complaints of persistent fatigue and shortness of breath on exertion. She has a history of asthma, but her symptoms have worsened recently.

------
Clinical Findings:
------
1. Vital signs: BP 130/85 mmHg, HR 98 bpm, RR 22 breaths/min
2. Auscultation revealed wheezing in both lung fields.
3. Oxygen saturation 96% at rest.
4. No signs of acute distress.

------
Assessment and Plan:
------
1. Chest X-ray ordered to rule out pneumonia or other lung pathology.
2. Increased dose of albuterol inhaler prescribed.
3. Referred for follow-up consultation with a pulmonologist at ABC Pulmonary Clinic.
4. Patient was advised to avoid allergens and limit exposure to irritants.

------

- Prescribed blood tests for IgE levels and chest X-ray
